The Story of the Foul-Smelling Mouth Ghost
“You bear a divine, beautiful, radiant complexion,

original: Vehāyasaṁ tiṭṭhasi antalikkhe;🔽Mukhañca te kimayo pūtigandhaṁ,
analyzed: vehāyasam tiṭṭhasi antalikkhe  mukham ca te kim ayaḥ pūti gandha
translated: you stand in the air in the sky;🔽but your mouth is eaten by maggots and stinks,
what deed did you do in the past?”

analyzed: samaṇaḥ aham pāpa uti duṭṭha vācaḥ  tapassi rūpaḥ mukhasāḥ asaññataḥ
translated: “I was a monk, but I was wicked in speech,🔽I was like an ascetic, but my mouth was unrestrained;

analyzed: laddhā ca me tapasā vaṇṇa dhātu
translated: and because of my ascetic practice I obtained a radiant complexion,
but because of my slander my mouth is foul-smelling.
This was seen by you, Nārada,
those who are compassionate would say what is skillful:

analyzed: mā pesuṇam mā ca musā abhāṇi
translated: ‘Do not slander, do not speak falsely,

analyzed: yakkhaḥ tuvam hohisi kāma kāmī iti
translated: you will become a lustful ghost.’”
The Story of the Foul-Smelling Mouth Ghost, the third.
